body:
Comment 4: 
I'm going to tinker with doctests in python. What if we drop a test script in there. (I
have an example I've been working with) along with a test gdb script.

So for example we have gdbtest.go, gdbtest.gdb. In python we make use of doctests or
unit tests to say something like:
"""
>> system("go build gdbtest.go")
>> system("gdb gdbtest < gdbtest.gdb")
"""
We can then parse the output and verify it matches some regexes. gdbtest.go and
gdbtest.gdb will need to be kept in sync.
